title: How to Make Shamrock Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Combine the butter and sugar in an electric mixer.
steps.description: Beat until the mixture becomes fluffy and looks pale.

steps.headline: Crack the eggs into a small mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat lightly.

steps.headline: Add the beaten eggs to the butter and sugar mixture slowly.
steps.description: Mix on medium speed. Mix until well combined. Add a little flour if it seems to curdle.

steps.headline: If using the Irish liqueur, add now.
steps.description: This step is optional.

steps.headline: Add the flour.
steps.description: Mix well at a slow speed.

steps.headline: Spoon the batter into 24 cupcake cases.
steps.description: Ensure an even amount in each cupcake.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 18-20 minutes. The cakes are ready when the they spring back to the touch and look lightly golden.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Leave to cool.

steps.headline: Follow the instructions on the package for preparing the pre-made royal icing.
steps.description: If you'd like the frosting to be green or orange, color lightly. Don't dye it if it will overwhelm the shamrock decoration though.

steps.headline: Use an icing palette knife to spread the royal icing on the top of each cupcake.
Roll out the green sugarpaste on a thin sprinkling of icing sugar.
steps.description: Roll to about 3mm in thickness.

steps.headline: Use the shamrock cutter to press out shamrock shapes in the sugarpaste.
Make up a little icing sugar to act as food glue.
steps.description: Dab a bit on the back of a shamrock before centering the shamrock shape on each cupcake. Press down gently.

steps.headline: Let the cupcakes sit for about half an hour before serving.
steps.description: This allows the icing to properly set.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Prepare the muffin pan.
steps.description: Put a cupcake liner into each muffin pan hole. Put a marble between the cupcake case and the pan in three places, one marble at the top and two to each side. The cupcake case will be squeezed into a Y shape.

steps.headline: Prepare the cupcake batter.
steps.description: Follow the package instructions.

steps.headline: Dye the batter green.
steps.description: Add a drop or two and mix. Keep adding drops until you're happy with the green color.

steps.headline: Spoon or pipe the batter into each cupcake case.
steps.description: This is quite tricky and piping is likely to be easiest.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 15 minutes or until the cake springs back when touched (or stick a toothpick in and if it comes out clean, it's ready).

steps.headline: Remove the cupcakes from the oven.
steps.description: Let cool in the pan, to help retain their shape. When cooled, pull out the marbles first, to release the cupcakes from the pan. Trim off any excess cake that didn't cook into the Shamrock shape. The marbles can be cleaned by a simple soapy wash.

steps.headline: Add a little green food coloring to the frosting.
steps.description: When you're happy with the green color, it's ready to use.

steps.headline: Pipe the cupcake with the green frosting.
Shape stems from the green fondant.
Stick the stems into the end of the cupcake to serve as the base.
steps.description: Done!

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Combine the butter and sugar in an electric mixer. Beat until the mixture becomes fluffy and looks pale. Crack the eggs into a small mixing bowl. Beat lightly. Add the beaten eggs to the butter and sugar mixture slowly. Mix on medium speed. Mix until well combined. Add a little flour if it seems to curdle. If using the Irish liqueur, add now. This step is optional. Add the flour. Mix well at a slow speed. Spoon the batter into 24 cupcake cases. Ensure an even amount in each cupcake. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 18-20 minutes. The cakes are ready when the they spring back to the touch and look lightly golden. Remove from the oven. Leave to cool. Follow the instructions on the package for preparing the pre-made royal icing. If you'd like the frosting to be green or orange, color lightly. Don't dye it if it will overwhelm the shamrock decoration though. Use an icing palette knife to spread the royal icing on the top of each cupcake.  Roll out the green sugarpaste on a thin sprinkling of icing sugar. Roll to about 3mm in thickness. Use the shamrock cutter to press out shamrock shapes in the sugarpaste.  Make up a little icing sugar to act as food glue. Dab a bit on the back of a shamrock before centering the shamrock shape on each cupcake. Press down gently. Let the cupcakes sit for about half an hour before serving. This allows the icing to properly set. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Prepare the muffin pan. Put a cupcake liner into each muffin pan hole. Put a marble between the cupcake case and the pan in three places, one marble at the top and two to each side. The cupcake case will be squeezed into a Y shape. Prepare the cupcake batter. Follow the package instructions. Dye the batter green. Add a drop or two and mix. Keep adding drops until you're happy with the green color. Spoon or pipe the batter into each cupcake case. This is quite tricky and piping is likely to be easiest. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 15 minutes or until the cake springs back when touched (or stick a toothpick in and if it comes out clean, it's ready). Remove the cupcakes from the oven. Let cool in the pan, to help retain their shape. When cooled, pull out the marbles first, to release the cupcakes from the pan. Trim off any excess cake that didn't cook into the Shamrock shape. The marbles can be cleaned by a simple soapy wash. Add a little green food coloring to the frosting. When you're happy with the green color, it's ready to use. Pipe the cupcake with the green frosting.  Shape stems from the green fondant.  Stick the stems into the end of the cupcake to serve as the base. Done!
